title: Next time you do Ocean Week Riot,

embed.description: Oceania is in peril! An evil entity is devouring our animals. Summoners from all over the region are rallying together, uniting under one banner to stop this malicious fiend. Oceanic Homeguards, it's time to take action!

body:
Please make the Hextech Keys Fragments drop-able regardless of whether or not you own the champion for the remainder of the event, once the all-champ-f2p reward is unlocked. As the all-champ-f2p is completely nullified by the fact key fragments don't drop if you are playing a champion you do not own, and thus people simply don't play the champs they do not own which is counter-intuitive to the cause.

That'd be awesome.

Or really, imo key fragments should drop regardless of whether or not you own a champion in the first place. But hey.

replies.body:
I agree wholeheartedly. If riot tries to encourage champion diversity by giving us 10 free champions every week, then not being able to acquire keys from wins with f2p champs seems counterintuitive.

Its not like keys aren't hard enough to get in the first place. My record for not receiving a key fragment for a win with a non-f2p champ is currently 22 in a row :/.

Hey guys, 

"There's currently a bug which prevents you from earning key fragments if you're playing a champion you don't own. This is unintended, and we're working on a solution."

Taken from the Hextech Crafting Guide [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide). I do not know when this will be solved but it's being worked on!

> [{quoted}](name=littlemisscheeky,realm=OCE,application-id=6jGZAhT1,discussion-id=rj5Ea9uY,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-02-03T12:29:47.641+0000)
>
> Hey guys, 
> 
> "There's currently a bug which prevents you from earning key fragments if you're playing a champion you don't own. This is unintended, and we're working on a solution."
> 
> Taken from the Hextech Crafting Guide [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide). I do not know when this will be solved but it's being worked on!

It's unintended? Didn't know that because there will always be a quote that specifically states that one can not earn keys if they're playing a champion they do not own in the end-game chat (if one's not playing an owned champion).

Maybe it was intended like that, but removed later and somehow for some reason it's still in the game, or that they only put up that line after realising the bug's existence as a temporarily headsup for people wondering why keys don't drop. Or something along those lines I won't know.

But hey, thanks for the update on the matter. I sincerely hope that would be fixed and lifted very soon. Please haste.
